sentence.Network_en: Women tend to personalise rejection more than men.
sentence.Network_cn: 一旦遭拒，女性比男性更容易将事情个人化。

entry.tran: 拒绝考虑;不接受;不同意
entry.def: If you reject something such as a proposal, a request, or an offer, you do not accept it or you do not agree to it.

example.ex: The British government is expected to reject the idea of state subsidy for a new high speed railway...
example.tran: 预计英国政府不会考虑为修建一条新的高速铁路提供国家补贴的设想。

example.ex: Seventeen publishers rejected the manuscript before Jenks saw its potential.
example.tran: 17家出版社回绝了这部手稿，直到詹克斯看到了它的潜在价值。

entry.tran: 摈弃，抛弃，不接受(信仰或政治制度)
entry.def: If you reject a belief or a political system, you refuse to believe in it or to live by its rules.

example.ex: ...the children of Eastern European immigrants who had rejected their parents' political and religious beliefs.
example.tran: 抛弃了父母一代政治和宗教信仰的东欧移民子女

entry.def: If someone is rejected for a job or course of study, it is not offered to them.

example.ex: One of my most able students was rejected by another university.
example.tran: 我的一个最有能力的学生申请另一所大学落选了。

entry.def: If someone rejects another person who expects affection from them, they are cold and unfriendly towards them.

example.ex: You make friends with people and then make unreasonable demands so that they reject you.
example.tran: 你和别人交朋友，然后向人家提出无理要求，结果被人家拒绝。

example.ex: ...people who had been rejected by their lovers.

entry.tran: 排斥(移植器官)；对…产生排斥反应
entry.def: If a person's body rejects something such as a new heart that has been transplanted into it, it tries to attack and destroy it.

example.ex: It was feared his body was rejecting a kidney he received in a transplant four years ago.
example.tran: 令人担心的是，他的身体可能对4年前移植的肾产生了排斥反应。

entry.def: If a machine rejects a coin that you put in it, the coin comes out and the machine does not work.
A reject is a product that has not been accepted for use or sale, because there is something wrong with it.

means.word_mean: 3. (medicine) an immunological response that refuses to accept substances or organisms that are recognized as foreign;

stems_affixes.word_buile: ab离开+ject抛→抛掉→可怜的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 形容词的,用作形容词的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ad增加+ject投掷,扔+ive……的→扔上去的,附加的
deject[v.使沮丧, 使灰心]+ed表形容词→adj.沮丧的,失望的
object[n.物体;客体,对象;目标;宾语 v.[to]反对]+ive……的→客观的[词性变化:作名词,表示"目标,目的"]
sub在下面+ject投掷,扔→扔下去→服从的,扔下去大家讨论的主题
ad增加+ject投掷,扔+ive……的→扔上去的,附加的
eject[v.投出,掷出]+ion表名词→n.喷出, 排出物
inter在……中间+ject投掷,扔+ion表名词→在句子中间扔出的字→感叹词

stems_affixes.value_cn: 物体;客体,对象;目标;宾语
stems_affixes.word_buile: ob逆,反+ject投掷,扔→反着扔→反对→引申为扔向目标

stems_affixes.value_cn: [to]反对,异议,不喜欢,反对的理由
stems_affixes.word_buile: object反对+ion表名词→n.[to]反对,异议,不喜欢,反对的理由
object[n.物体;客体,对象;目标;宾语 v.[to]反对]+ive……的→客观的[词性变化:作名词,表示"目标,目的"]
pro向前+ject扔→扔向前面→投射;引申为工程项目
project[v.投射出;n.工程项目]+ile物体→向前扔的物体
project[v.投射出;n.工程项目]+ion表名词→n.射出,投射;计划
re回+ject扔回来→拒绝
reject[v.拒绝,抵制,丢弃,排斥,退掉 n.落选者]+ion表名词→n.退回,拒绝
sub在下面+ject投掷,扔→扔下去→服从的,扔下去大家讨论的主题
subject[n.主题;学科 adj.隶属的;易遭..的 v.使隶属]+ion表名词→n.征服
subject主观+ivity表名词→n.主观性, 主观
tra穿+ject投掷,扔+ory范围→扔出去穿过的范围→弹道轨道
con共同+ject投掷,扔+ure表名词→大家一起扔[思想]→推测
de向下+ject投掷,扔→情绪向下扔→沮丧
e出+ject掷→掷出
in进入+ject投掷,扔→扔进去→注射
ob逆,反+ject投掷,扔→反着扔→反对→引申为扔向目标
pro向前+ject扔→扔向前面→投射;引申为工程项目

Sentence.sentence: They're willing to do the hard work of identifying their valuable skills; be creative about where and how to look; learn how to present themselves to potential employers; and keep going, even after repeated rejections.
Were they tuned off because an American had the nerve to instruct Japanese in their own art form or they deliberately tried to signal their rejection of her?
On the other hand, rejection occurs when others treat you in a manner that is inconsistent with yourself definition.
These should discourage retailers from wasteful practices that lead to the rejection of food on the basis of cosmetic characteristics, and losses in the home due to excessive purchasing by consumers.
Reporters can tolerate rejection of their ideas if they believe they were given a fair hearing.

sentences.en: Constant rejection has sapped her will.
sentences.cn: 不断的被拒绝逐渐使她丧失了信心。

sentences.en: He decided not to approach her for fear of rejection.
sentences.cn: 他因怕遭拒绝决定不再去找她。

sentences.en: The rejection plunged her into the dark depths of despair.
sentences.cn: 遭到拒绝使她陷入了绝望的深渊。

sentences.en: the rejection of the child by its mother
the rejection of parental values by a child
sentences.cn: 孩子对父母价值观的排斥

sentences.en: Violent behaviour and rejection by society are mutually reinforcing.
sentences.cn: 暴力行为和遭到社会排斥正在恶性循环。
